channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report X-2023120981
item.description:
Report X-2023120981

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-18
  • City: CHANDLER
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered on unload trailer and taken to designated area for reporting. DescribePack: Upon testing the caps on the inner packages, one cap was barely closed and came off easily. Top half of outer packaging is soiled. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Bottle caps were secured and contents placed in a hazmat plastic lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023120939
item.description:
Report X-2023120939

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-17
  • City: CHANDLER
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded from trailer and was sent up the sorter. Package sealed in hazmat bag and brought down to QA area for inspection. DescribePack: Two cans were not sealed and loose caps allowed for small leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cans were removed from packaging and placed in hazmat tote in designated area for further investigation.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: package found open and wet upon inspection the lids on the bottle had come loose causing an internal leak there was no packing to protect product DescribePack: lids on top came loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: i place package in hazmat bag then placed in yellow drum for processing

item.title: Report X-2023120980
item.description:
Report X-2023120980

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-19
  • City: TEMPE
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking during the unloading of a truck and QA was notified and package was put into lined hazmat tote. DescribePack: Inner container was dented and punctured. Dent was 2 inches wide and hole was about 2 millimeters wide. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was placed into a lined hazmat tote and taken to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report E-2023120412
item.description:
Report E-2023120412

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-09
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported an industrial battery with a 4 inch crack in it's plastic top at terminal UPH due to improper loading. An estimated 4 oz of battery acid released tot he top of the battery. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The battery was re-secured and shrink-wrapped. 1- 30 gallon poly drum of spent absorbents and PPE was created onsite for the terminal to manage.
